algorithms.html: The following steps are added to the processing extension-point in determining the web app's chosen display mode:

steps.html: For each candidate_display_mode of manifest.display_override member:
If display modes list contains candidate_display_mode, return that candidate_display_mode
If candidate_display_mode is window-controls-overlay and the user agent supports this, then return that candidate_display_mode.
If candidate_display_mode is tabbed and the user agent supports this, then return that candidate_display_mode.

algorithms.html: To facilitate all of the new extension and incubation features added by this specification, the user agent SHOULD run the following during the extension point in processing a manifest (having access to URL document URL, URL manifest URL, ordered map json, and ordered map manifest):

steps.html: Process the tab_strip member, passing json, manifest and manifest URL.
Process the note_taking member, passing json, manifest and manifest URL.
Process the protocol_handlers member, passing json and manifest.
Process the file_handlers member, passing json, manifest and manifest URL.

algorithms.html: When navigating the top-level traversable associated with a home tab context to a URL url that is outside of home tab scope, the following steps are run:

steps.html: Let top-level traversable tab be the result of choosing a navigable with a target of "_blank" and noopener true.
Instead of navigating the home-tab traversable, navigate tab with the same parameters.
Apply the current application manifest to tab's top-level browsing context.
The user agent SHOULD place tab in the same window as the home-tab navigable.
Focus <var data-type="toplevel traversable">tab</var>.

algorithms.html: When navigating a top-level traversable with a display mode of tabbed that is not associated with a home tab context (i.e. a non-home tab) to a URL url that is within home tab scope, the following steps are run:

steps.html: Let hometab be the top-level traversable of the home tab context associated with the current window.
Instead of navigating the top-level traversable, navigate hometab with the same parameters.
Focus <var data-type="toplevel traversable">hometab</var>.

algorithms.html:
When the new tab button is activated by the end user, the following
          steps are run:

steps.html: Create a new application context in the current window and focus it.
Navigate it to the value of the url member of new_tab_button.

algorithms.name: process the tab_strip member
algorithms.html: To process the tab_strip member, given ordered map json, ordered map manifest, and URL manifest URL, run the following during the extension point in processing a manifest:

steps.html: Set manifest["tab_strip"] to a new ordered map.
If json["tab_strip"] does not exist or json["tab_strip"] is not an ordered map:

Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["tab_strip"]["new_tab_button"]["url"] to
              <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["start_url"].
Return.
Process the home_tab member passing json["tab_strip"], manifest["tab_strip"], and manifest URL.
Process the new_tab_button member passing json["tab_strip"], manifest["tab_strip"], manifest URL, and manifest["start_url"].

algorithms.name: process the home_tab member
algorithms.html: To process the home_tab member, given ordered map json tab strip, ordered map manifest tab strip, and URL manifest URL, run the following:

steps.html: If json tab strip["home_tab"] does not exist or json tab strip["home_tab"] not an ordered map, return.
Let home tab be a new ordered map.
Process the scope_patterns member passing json tab strip["home_tab"]["scope_patterns"], home tab and manifest URL.
Set <var>manifest tab strip</var>["home_tab"] to <var data-type="ordered map">home tab</var>.

algorithms.name: process the new_tab_button member
algorithms.html: To process the new_tab_button member, given ordered map json tab strip, ordered map manifest tab strip, URL manifest URL, and URL start URL, run the following:

steps.html:
Set <var>manifest tab strip</var>["new_tab_button"]["url"] to <var data-type="URL">start
            URL</var>.
If json tab strip["new_tab_button"] does not exist or json tab strip["new_tab_button"] is not an ordered map, return.
Let url be the result of parsing json tab strip["new_tab_button"]["url"] with manifest URL as the base URL.
If <var data-type="URL">url</var> is failure, return.
If url is not within scope of manifest URL, return.
Set <var>manifest tab strip</var>["new_tab_button"]["url"] to <var data-type="URL">url</var>.

algorithms.name: process the scope_patterns member
algorithms.html: To process the scope_patterns member, given ordered map json home tab, ordered map manifest home tab and URL manifest URL, run the following:

steps.html: Let processed scope patterns be a new list.

Set <var>manifest home tab</var>["scope_patterns"] to <var>processed scope
            patterns</var>.
If json home tab["scope_patterns"] doesn't exist or json home tab["scope_patterns"] is not a list, return.

For each <var data-type="URLPatternInit">entry</var> of <var>json home
            tab</var>["scope_patterns"]:
Let pattern be the result of building a URL pattern from an infra value entry given manifest URL. If this process throws or returns null, continue.
Append <var data-type="URL pattern">pattern</var> to <var data-type="list">processed scope patterns</var>.

algorithms.name: process the note_taking member
algorithms.html: To process the note_taking member, given ordered map json, ordered map manifest, URL manifest_URL, run the following during the extension point in processing a manifest:

steps.html: If json["note_taking"] does not exist, return.
If the type of json["note_taking"] is not ordered map, return.
Set manifest["note_taking"] to a new ordered map.
process the new_note_url member passing json["note_taking"], manifest["note_taking"], and manifest URL.

algorithms.name: process the new_note_url member
algorithms.html: To process the new_note_url member, given ordered map json_note_taking, ordered map manifest_note_taking, URL manifest_URL, run the following:

steps.html: If json_note_taking["new_note_url"] does not exist, return.
If the type of json_note_taking["new_note_url"] is not string, return.
Let new_note_url be the result of parsing json_note_taking["new_note_url"] with manifest URL as the base URL.
If <var data-type="URL">new_note_url</var> is failure, return.
If new_note_url is not within scope of manifest URL, return.
Set manifest_note_taking["new_note_url"] to <var data-type="URL">new_note_url</var>.

algorithms.name: launch the new_note_url
algorithms.html: To launch the new_note_url, given processed manifest manifest, run the following steps:

steps.html: If manifest["note_taking"] does not exist, return.
If manifest["note_taking"]["new_note_url"] does not exist, return.
If the type of manifest["note_taking"]["new_note_url"] is not URL, return.
Run the steps to launch a web application setting manifest to manifest and target URL to manifest["note_taking"]["new_note_url"].

algorithms.name: process the protocol_handlers member
algorithms.html: To process the protocol_handlers member, given object json, manifest:

steps.html: Let processedProtocolHandlers be a new list of json["protocol_handlers"].

Set manifest["<var>protocol_handlers</var>"] to
          <var>processedProtocolHandlers</var>.
For each protocol_handler (protocol handler description):
If protocol_handler["protocol"] or protocol_handler["url"] is undefined, continue.

Let (normalizedProtocol, normalizedUrl) be the result of running normalize protocol handler parameters with protocol_handler["protocol"], | protocol_handler|["url"] using manifest URL as the base URL, and this's relevant environment settings object. If the result is failure, continue.
If normalizedUrl is not within scope of manifest, continue.
If processedProtocolHandlers contains the normalizedUrl, continue.
Append protocol_handler to processedProtocolHandlers.
For each processedProtocolHandlers, the user agent SHOULD register a protocol handler.

algorithms.name: process the file_handlers member
algorithms.html: To process the file_handlers member, given ordered map json, ordered map manifest, URL manifest_url:

steps.html: Let processedFileHandlers be a new list.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["file_handlers"] to <var data-type="list">processedFileHandlers</var>.
If json["file_handlers"] doesn't exist or json["file_handlers"] is not a list, return.
For each entry of json["file_handlers"]:
Let file_handler be process a file handler item with entry, start_url, scope, and manifest_url.
If file_handler is failure, continue.
Append file_handler to processedFileHandlers.

algorithms.name: process a file handler item
algorithms.html: To process a file handler item, given ordered map item, URL start_url, URL scope, and URL manifest URL:

steps.html:
Return failure if any of the following is true:
  • item["action"] doesn't exist or is not a string.
  • item["accept"] doesn't exist.
  • item["accept"] is not a dictionary.
  • item["accept"] is empty.
Let url be the result of parsing item["action"] with manifest_url URL as the base URL.
If <var data-type="URL">url</var> is failure, return failure.
If url is not within scope of scope, return failure.
Let launch_type be a new string initialized to "single-client".
If item["launch_type"] exists and is "multiple-clients", set launch_type to item["launch_type"].
Let accept be a new ordered map.
for each mime_type_string extensions of item["accept"]
If extensions is not a list, continue.
If extensions is empty, continue.
If extensions contains items that are not strings, continue.
If extensions contains strings that do not begin with the character ., continue.
If extensions contains strings that are greater than 16 characters long, continue.
Let mime_type_parsed be the result of running the steps of parse a mime type on mime_type_string.
If mime_type_parsed is failure, continue.
If |mime_type_parsed/type| is not listed as a top-level type in [IANA-MEDIA-TYPES], continue.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">accept</var>[<var data-type="string">mime_type_string</var>] to <var>extensions</var>.
If <var data-type="ordered map">accept</var> is empty, return failure.

Let <var data-type="ordered map">file_handler</var> be <var>ordered map</var> [ "action" 
          <var data-type="URL">url</var>, "name"  <var data-type="ordered map">item</var>["name"], "launch_type"  <var data-type="string">launch_type</var>,
          "accept"  <var data-type="ordered map">accept</var> ].
Process image resources passing item["icons"], file_handler, manifest URL, and "icons".
Return <var data-type="ordered map">file_handler</var>.

algorithms.name: execute a file handler launch
algorithms.html: The steps to execute a file handler launch are given by the following algorithm. The algorithm takes list files and a ordered map manifest which holds results from processing a manifest.

steps.html: Let <var data-type="list">file_handlers</var> be <var data-type="ordered_map">manifest</var>["file_handlers"].
If <var data-type="list">file_handlers</var> is null, return.
Let launches be an ordered map.
for each filename of files
for each file_handler of file_handlers:
for each mime_type_string extensions of file_handler["accept"]
for each extension of extensions:
If filename does not end in extension, continue.
If launches[file_handler] exists, append filename to launches[file_handler].
Else, set launches[file_handler] to a list with the single element filename.
Continue to next element of files.
for each file_handler files of launches

If <var data-type="ordered_map">file_handler</var>["launch_type"] is equal to
              "multiple-clients"
for each file of files
Let params be a new LaunchParams with files set to a FrozenArray with a single element that is a FileSystemHandle corresponding to file.
Launch a web application with handling, passing manifest and params.
Else,
Let params be a new LaunchParams with files set to a FrozenArray of FileSystemHandles that correspond to the file paths named by files.
Launch a web application with handling, passing manifest and params.

algorithms.name: present an install prompt
algorithms.html:
To <dfn data-local-lt="presenting an install prompt|presentation of the install prompt" data-lt="present an install prompt|presenting an install prompt|presentation of the install prompt" id="dfn-present-an-install-prompt" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">present
        an install prompt</dfn>:

steps.html: Show some user-agent-specific UI, asking the user whether to proceed with installing the app. The result of this choice is either "accepted" or "dismissed".
Return result, and in parallel:
If result is "accepted", run the steps to install the web application.

algorithms.name: steps to notify that an install prompt is available
algorithms.html:
The <dfn id="dfn-steps-to-notify-that-an-install-prompt-is-available" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">steps to notify that an install prompt is available</dfn> are
        given by the following algorithm:

steps.html: Wait until the Document of the top-level browsing context is completely loaded.
If there is already an install prompt being presented or if the steps to install the web application are currently being executed, then abort this step.
Queue a task on the application life-cycle task source to do the following:

Let mayShowPrompt be the result of fire an event named "beforeinstallprompt" at the top-level browsing context's relevant global object using the BeforeInstallPromptEvent interface, with steps to initialize the cancelable attribute to true.
If mayShowPrompt is true, then the user agent MAY, in parallel, request to present an install prompt with event.

algorithms.name: steps to install the web application
algorithms.html:
The <dfn id="dfn-steps-to-install-the-web-application" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">steps to install the web application</dfn> are given by the
          following algorithm:

steps.html:
Let <var>manifest</var> be the manifest of an installable
          document.

Perform an unspecified sequence of actions to attempt to register
          the web application in the user's operating system (e.g., create
          shortcuts that launch the web application, register the application
          in the system uninstall menu, etc.). If the installation fails (which
          can be for any reason, for example, the OS denying permission to the
          user agent to add an icon to the home screen of the device), abort
          these steps.
Queue a task on the application life-cycle task source to fire an event named "appinstalled" at the top-level browsing context's relevant global object for which the installation took place.

algorithms.name: BeforeInstallPromptEvent/prompt()
algorithms.html: The prompt method, when called, runs the following steps:

steps.html: Let userResponsePromise be [[userResponsePromise]].
If <var>userResponsePromise</var> is pending:
If this.[[didPrompt]] is true, terminate this algorithm.
If this event's isTrusted attribute is false, reject userResponsePromise with "NotAllowedError" and terminate this algorithm.
Set this.[[didPrompt]] to true.
In parallel, request to present an install prompt with this. Wait, possibly indefinitely, for the end-user to make a choice.
Return <var>userResponsePromise</var>.

algorithms.name: request to present an install prompt
algorithms.html: To request to present an install prompt with BeforeInstallPromptEvent event:

steps.html: Present an install prompt and let outcome be the result.
Let response be a newly created PromptResponseObject, initializing its userChoice to outcome.
Resolve event.[[userResponsePromise]] with response.
